entry.name: jQuery.isNumeric
entry.title: jQuery.isNumeric()
entry.desc: Determines whether its argument represents a Javascript number.

longdesc.p: The $.isNumeric() method checks whether a value is a finite number or Number object, or a Number-castable string or String object representing one. If so, it returns true. Otherwise it returns false. The argument can be of any type.

example.desc: Sample return values of $.isNumeric with various inputs.
example.code: $.isNumeric( "-10" ); // true $.isNumeric( 16 ); // true $.isNumeric( 0xFF ); // true $.isNumeric( "0xFF" ); // true $.isNumeric( "8e5" ); // true (exponential notation string) $.isNumeric( 3.1415 ); // true $.isNumeric( +10 ); // true $.isNumeric( 0144 ); // true (octal integer literal) $.isNumeric( "" ); // false $.isNumeric({}); // false (empty object) $.isNumeric( NaN ); // false $.isNumeric( null ); // false $.isNumeric( true ); // false $.isNumeric( Infinity ); // false $.isNumeric( undefined ); // false
